<a href="http://www.cnn.com/CNNI/Programs/middle.east/blog/uploaded_images/cage-714170.jpg"><img style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN: 0px auto 10px; CURSOR: hand; TEXT-ALIGN: center" alt="" src="http://www.cnn.com/CNNI/Programs/middle.east/blog/uploaded_images/cage-713577.jpg" border="0" /></a>An Israeli protester sits in a cage during a demonstration calling for the release of Israeli soldier Cpl. Gilad Schalit who is being held captive in Gaza, in front of Israeli Defense Minister Ehud Barak's house in Tel-Aviv, Monday Oct. 20, 2008.<br /><br />Schalit was captured in a June 25, 2006 raid by militants who tunneled under the Gaza-Israel border and attacked an Israeli army post, killing two soldiers and taking Schalit with them. (AP Photo/Moti Milrod)
